sentences.en: A scene of revelry met their eyes.
After a night of drunken revelry they ended up in the dock.
sentences.cn: 一夜醉酒作乐后,他们都出现在被告席上.

sentences.en: As we got close to Broadway, we heard the sounds of revelry getting louder and louder.
sentences.cn: 我们接近百老汇时，听到人们饮酒狂欢的声音越来越大。

sentences.en: Below the sound of revelry continued.
sentences.cn: 楼下寻欢作乐的声音不断传来.

sentences.en: Grotesque masks along in a burst of pre - Lenten revelry in Nice, France.
sentences.cn: 怪异荒诞的面具在法国尼斯四旬斋前狂欢中上下摆动.

sentences.en: He knew their customary revelry was going on.
sentences.cn: 他知道他们正在举行例行宴会.

sentences.en: It was generally believed to be a time of revelry.
sentences.cn: 人们通常认为这是狂欢的时节.
那似乎是酗酒作乐的吵闹声.

sentences.en: Let our revelry be suited to the spring!
sentences.cn: 让我们的欢宴不辱春光!

sentences.en: Ostentation and revelry were ceased, for the sake of separation.
sentences.cn: 停止浮华与狂欢, 因为分开.

sentences.en: The feasting, drinking, dancing and revelry continued for several days.
sentences.cn: 一连几天都是宴会、痛饮、舞蹈和狂欢。

sentences.en: The sound of revelry filled the house yesterday.
sentences.cn: 昨天这个屋子里充满了欢闹声.

sentences.en: They in god di revelry, they to spacious worship born that way.
sentences.cn: 他们在神邸狂欢, 他们对宽敞的朝拜与生俱来.

sentences.en: We could hear sounds of revelry from next door.
sentences.cn: 我们能够听到隔壁纵饮狂欢的声音。

sentences.en: While the house of the rich and powerful present a scene of feasting and revelry, cries of hunger and cold are heard out in the streets.
sentences.cn: 豪门灯红酒绿, 街头啼饥号寒.

words.tran_cn: 狂欢；闹饮；喜庆狂欢活动
欢宴者，狂欢者；饮酒狂欢者；摆设酒宴者

trans.tran_cn: 寻欢作乐，狂欢，（喧闹的）欢宴
trans.tran_en: wild noisy dancing, eating, drinking etc, usually to celebrate something
